qas.question: During what conflict did the US occupy the Marshall Islands?
What was the name of the campaign in which the US occupied the Marshalls?

answers.text: the Gilbert and Marshall Islands campaign

qas.question: In what year did the United States occupy the Marshalls?
How many months did it take for the US to occupy Kwajalein Atoll, Majuro and Enewetak?
Along with Mili, Maloelap and Jaluit, what parts of the Marshall Islands were not occupied in the first three months of the American campaign?

context: In <a0_0>World War II<a0_0/>, the United States, during <a1_0>the Gilbert and Marshall Islands campaign<a1_0/>, invaded and occupied the islands in <a2_0>1944<a2_0/>, destroying or isolating the Japanese garrisons. In just <a3_0>one<a3_0/> month in 1944, Americans captured Kwajalein Atoll, Majuro and Enewetak, and, in the next two months, the rest of the Marshall Islands, except for <a4_0>Wotje<a4_0/>, Mili, Maloelap and Jaluit.
